dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4991 IH: To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to commence a rule making to establish a U.S. Customs and Border Protection international port of entry at the Port of Stockton and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Duarte introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to commence a rule making to establish a U.S. Customs and Border Protection international port of entry at the Port of Stockton and for other purposes.

section.header: Rule making to establish a U.S. Customs and Border Protection international port of entry at the Port of Stockton
section.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security shall commence a rule making to establish a U.S. Customs and Border Protection international port of entry at the Port of Stockton in the State of California.
